program: Master of Science in Electrical Engineering (MS)

sections.text: Stanford’s EE MS offers advanced preparation in electrical engineering subfields while providing flexibility to tailor a 45‑unit study plan without a thesis requirement.

items: 45 units total; depth, breadth, and technical requirements
200‑level lecture courses for most EE credits
sections.text: Students design an approved program of study meeting depth/breadth expectations; most courses are 200‑level EE lecture courses.

items: Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field recommended
Transcripts and application materials per department
Minimum unit and course distribution per Bulletin
sections.text: Admission and degree completion follow department and University policies; students must satisfy unit distribution and academic standards.
Graduates work in hardware, communications, signal processing, computer engineering, and emerging areas such as AI hardware.
